page.title: 19FARMING AND HORSES
page.content:
Most of the farms in the area own some machinery. All will have a tractor although some of these are quite old, at least 25 years. Larger machinery such as balers and combines may be hired and we even saw a mobile sheep dip. This was a large lorry that drives round to the fields where the sheep are so they do not need to be brought to the farm for dipping. A policeman has to check each dipping session to see that the sheep have been properly treated.
In addition to the gymkana run by of the local farms there is also a pony club meeting in July near King's Brompton Common. In spite of the isolated position this was very well attended in 1985, we saw at least twenty horse boxes in the field.
